intro: Napaea lobata, commonly known as the mountain holly or false holly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in mountainous regions. Its small, white or pinkish flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, adding ornamental value to its natural habitat. Napaea lobata is often used in native plant gardens due to its hardiness and aesthetic appeal.
